prs.title: Adds LibreCapital nav EA
prs.truncated_body:
## Closes [DF-21507](https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/DF-21507)



## Changes

- Adds a new external adapter to retrieve and return the latest NAV for a specified LibreCapital fund

## Steps to Test

1. Integration tests
2. Via local server
Test payload
```
POST http://127.0.0.1:8080
{
  "data": {
    "endpoint": "nav",
    "globalFundID": 1234

  }
}

```

prs.title: fix edge case in unsed imports check script
prs.truncated_body:
This PR fixes the following edge cases in the unused-imports-check script 

- if the import name is used within the contract file but within string quotes, the import is wrongly marked as used

- if the import name is used after a comment indicator that came after some code has been written on the same line e.g
```sol
     a = 15 // importName ....
```

commits.message: fix edge case in unsed imports check script

prs.title: cannon: Create framework for differential tests
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Introduce a new "DiffTester" framework to run differential tests for single vm steps.  This allows us to inspect test expectations and inject additional test cases as necessary.  

For example, if a test expects the vm's memory to be updated, we can [inject an addi

commits.message: In progress - start working on difftester framework
Use factory methods for test dependencies
For simplicity, drop validator logic, TestContext for the time being
Rework difftester - add test cases intead of modifying tests

Expand DiffTester to accommodate more types of tests

- Pass the vm to SetExpectationsFn
- Return an ExpectedExecResult from SetExpectationsFn to handle panics
Migrate some tests that use the new DiffTester features
Add some unit tests for difftester
Cleanup - narrow test assertions, drop unused helper
Auto-generate random seed from testcase name

prs.title: op-dispute-mon: Fix racy test
prs.truncated_body:
Fix potential race condition in the `TestMonitor_StartMonitoring` unit test that could result in flakes (though quite unlikely).

Motivation to do this is to clean up issues flagged by the go race detector so we can start using the `-race` flag in CI for proofs components.

prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
This PR includes retry mechanisms for common kurtosis startup failures. When a system is under load or the network connection is unstable, kurtosis may fail to start because the network requests can't be properly processed. We now do retries (x3) in the most common fai

prs.title: fix: update stk exp validations
fix: do not add multistaked fps to voting table (backport #1366)
prs.truncated_body:
In some places check `k.BTCStakingKeeper.HasFinalityProvider` was overloaded to mean `is is Babylon finality provider` as only `BTCStakingKeeper` stored Babylon finality providers.  https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/pull/1300 moved all finality providers to the `BTCStakingKeeper`, so the overloaded check lost its power. 

This could lead to non-Babylon finality providers registering random

commits.message:
fix: do not add multistaked fps to voting table (#1366)

In some places check `k.BTCStakingKeeper.HasFinalityProvider` was
overloaded to mean `is is Babylon finality provider` as only
`BTCStakingKeeper` stored Babylon finality providers.
https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/pull/1300 moved all finality
providers to the `BTCStakingKeeper`, so the overloaded check lost its
power.

This could lead to non-Babylon finality providers registering randomness
and gaining voting power on Babylon genesis.

(cherry picked from commit cddee9e00da0aad9d257e224e5a3f4fb602eb382)

prs.title: fix: do not add multistaked fps to voting table
prs.truncated_body:
In some places check `k.BTCStakingKeeper.HasFinalityProvider` was overloaded to mean `is is Babylon finality provider` as only `BTCStakingKeeper` stored Babylon finality providers.  https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/pull/1300 moved all finality providers to the `BTCStakingKeeper`, so the overloaded check lost its power. 

This could lead to non-Babylon finality providers registering rand

prs.title: chore(epoching): enhance the QueuedMsgs API  (backport #1347)
prs.truncated_body:
closes: https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/issues/1312

Adds a new enriched_msg field to `QueuedMessageResponse`, allowing clients to distinguish between messages like `MsgDelegate` and `MsgUndelegate` even if their raw msg field looks identical.

<hr>This is an automatic backport of pull request #1347 done by [Mergify](https://mergify.com).

closes: https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/issues/1312

Adds a new enriched_msg field to `QueuedMessageResponse`, allowing
clients to distinguish between messages like `MsgDelegate` and
`MsgUndelegate` even if their raw msg field looks identical.

(cherry picked from commit dacf4957485ec399dd3755699442ad19af69e6f6)

## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR

This PR is a part of project reduce transaction latency.
It adds a 2 flags `gossip.enablebroadcasttoall` to enable node to broadcast transactions/blocks to all peers. and `gossip.broadcasttoallcap` to set the maximum number of peers for broadcasting, preventing network congestion.

Meanwhile changed existing flag names from `txgossip.disablebroadc

prs.title: Stop miner when reorg from milestone
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This resolved a possible race condition when a milestone reorg happens at the same time when a validator mines a new block. The miner should be completely stopped when setHead canonical head and inserting finalized chain. Without this, a block producing node can get stuck after a reorg.

# Changes

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change that solves an issue)
- [ ] Hotfix (change t

commits.message:
Stop miner when reorg from milestone

This resolved a possible race condition when a milestone reorg happens at the same time when a validator mines a new block. The miner should be completely stopped when setHead canonical head and inserting finalized chain.

prs.title: flamenco: fix stack out-of-bounds when using the precompile feature offset
prs.truncated_body:
Fixing ASAN crash report when replaying ledgers:

prs.title: IGP103
fix(fortuna): correctly propagate contract reverts in simulation
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Fix a bug preventing contract reverts during simulation from being captured correctly.

## Rationale

`client.fill_transaction` does a couple things including estimating gas usage and fetching the current gas price. If the contract reverts during the estimating gas phase via simulation, the code expects the error to be propagated as a `GasUsageEstimateError(ContractError::Revert(

prs.title: Add contractevent macro and event support to contract spec
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Add `contractevent` macro for defining events, and event support to contract spec.

In it's most basic form, as follows, where an automatic prefix topic based on the name will be published, with any topic fields appended to the topic list, and any other fields emitted as map entries in a map:

```rust
    #[contractevent]
    #[derive(Clone, Default, Debug, Eq, PartialEq)]
    p

commits.message: rename prefix_topics to topics in event macros
improve the compiler error when the event field name is too long by including the max length
fix topic output in code gen and add tests for code gen
fix bug where specs not available when not exporting
fix event parameter sorting for map

prs.title: Fix/refactor signing paths
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Closes https://github.com/stellar/stellar-cli/issues/2008

### Why
We previously had 2 paths to signing tx, one was used in the `tx sign` (sign_with), and the other path was used in the rest of the tx signing (using signer.sign directly). Making sure that all signing goes through one path seems less likely to introduce bugs when working on the signing flow. 

### Known limitations

commits.message: Use a hd_path helper fn in Config

Change sign_with_local_key to just sign

since its now possible to sign with more than just local keys

Allow for source_account to be the default signer

this is how signing was behaving when _not_ using sign_with

prs.title: feat(shed): lotus-shed miner fees-inspect improvements
prs.truncated_body:
- Proper CSV output
- Add --output to write to a file
- Add resume capability from last processed epoch when using --output
- --tipset only required if not resuming, now means "start"
- --count is optional, will default to chain head
- Always walk from oldest to newest so keeping a file updated is easier
- Nice progress indicator when writing to a file
- Improve efficiency comment for inspe

commits.message:
feat(shed): lotus-shed miner fees-inspect improvements

- Proper CSV output
- Add --output to write to a file
- Add resume capability from last processed epoch when using --output
- --tipset only required if not resuming, now means "start"
- --count is optional, will default to chain head
- Always walk from oldest to newest so keeping a file updated is easier
- Nice progress indicator when writing to a file
- Improve efficiency comment for inspectMiner function

prs.title: fix: Payment request bigint issues
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation
In some hard-to-define cases the Payment Request QR Code was crashing the app. This happened because the `token` object passed as parameter had the `balances` populated in it, containing bigint values.

Since those values are not necessary for the QR generation, they were simply removed from redux through the reducer.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Fixes a BigInt issue happening w

- remove treasury, alice and bob accounts from exaamples `.env` because `solo` doesn't use auto generated accounts so we need to set them up
- disable long term schedule transactions and long term schedule tests
- use 0.0.1002 account instead of 0.0.2

Fixes #2757

**Notes for reviewer**:
